p: The simulated climatological mean annual cycles of downward surface longwave clear-sky radiation from the 37 CMIP5 models are compared in Fig. 10 with the BSRN reference climatologies at the 31 stations where such reference climatologies could be established (see Sect. 3, Table 1). In Fig. 10a, the annual cycles of the models are again shown in red, whereas the BSRN reference climatologies are given in black. The associated differences between the model-calculated and observed annual cycles are displayed in Fig. 10b. As in the shortwave (Fig. 4), the models overall reproduce the BSRN annual cycles reasonably well. This gives confidence in both model-simulated and observation-derived fluxes, which are completely independently obtained.
